question:
What is the output of the following code for the books.csv seen above? 
file_obj = open("books.csv")

csv_read = file_obj.readline()

print(csv_read)

answers.text: ['Title, Author, Pages ', '1984, George Orwell, 268 ', 'Jane Eyre, Charlotte Bronte, 532 ', 'Walden, Henry David Thoreau, 156 ', 'Moby Dick, Herman Melville, 538']

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: This is the result of running line 19 in the code example above. But this result occurs after the processing in lines 6-16 of the example.

answers.text: [['Title', ' Author', ' Pages'], ['1984', ' George Orwell', ' 268'], ['Jane Eyre', ' Charlotte Bronte', ' 532'], ['Walden', ' Henry David Thoreau', ' 156'], ['Moby Dick', ' Herman Melville', ' 538']]

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: The function readlines() reads the complete contents of the file books.csv. But line 3 in the code uses readline().
The first line of the books.csv is read into csv_read. The first line is 'Title, Author, Pages', which is the same as the first row.

detailedSolution: The first line of the books.csv is read into csv_read. The first line is 'Title, Author, Pages', which is the same as the first row.
